intro: Craibiodendron scleranthum var. kwangtungense, commonly known as the Kwangtung sandwort, is a flowering plant native to China. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
